result.execSummary:
All charges against George Lee Snyder in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. George Lee Snyder is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: 1:00 PM Defendant George Lee Snyder not in court.  Attorney Justin W. Henry not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant passed away on July 3, 2022. Court dismisses matter at State's request.
